translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اين مجادله اهل آتش قطعاً راست است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این منازعه اهل آتش دوزخ محقق و حتمی است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این (گفتگوهائی را که از زبان دوزخیان بیان داشتیم) یک واقعیّت است (و قطعاً در وقت خود به وقوع می‌پیوندد) و نزاع و سخنان خصمانه‌ی دوزخیان با یکدیگر خواهد بود. [[«لَحَقٌّ»: مراد از حقیقت داشتن، وقوع و تحقّق است. «تَخَاصُمُ»: ستیزه و پرخاش. خبر مبتدای محذوف و تقدیر چنین است: هُوَ تَخَاصُمُ. و جمله (تَخَاصُمُ أَهْلِ النَّارِ) بیان (ذلِکَ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان ستیزه دوزخیان با همدیگر حق است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این یک واقعیت است گفتگوهای خصمانه دوزخیان!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا این است حقّ ستیزه کردن اهل آتش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه اين ستيزه‌گرى دوزخيان با يكديگر است كه راست و سزاست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: این (ذلت) به‌راستی راست و بسی پای‌برجاست: مجادله‌ی اهل آتش.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: This contending of the inmates of Hell will surely be real.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed this is really true – the people of the hell quarrelling among themselves.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely that is true -- the disputing of the inhabitants of the Fire.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily this is the very truth: the wrangling of the fellows of the Fire!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, that is the very truth, the mutual dispute of the people of the Fire!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: This is certainly true—the feuding of the people of the Fire.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Verily all this is true. This is how the inmates of the Fire will dispute among themselves.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, that is the very truth -- the mutual dispute of the people of the Fire!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! that is very truth: the wrangling of the dwellers in the Fire.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: That is indeed a true account of the contentions of the inmates of the Fire.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Surely that is true the disputing of the inhabitants of the Fire

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, that is truth - the quarreling of the people of the Fire.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Such disputes will certainly take place among the dwellers of hell fire.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: That most surely is the truth: the contending one with another of the inmates of the fire.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna thalika lahaqqun takhasumu ahli alnnari

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: All this is certainly true -- the inhabitants of the Fire will blame one another in this way.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Truly that is just and fitting,- the mutual recriminations of the People of the Fire!

verses.text: قُلْ‌ إِنَّمَا أَنَا مُنْذِرٌ وَ مَا مِنْ‌ إِلٰهٍ‌ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ‌ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: من فقط بیم دهنده ام، و هیچ معبودی جز خدای یگانه قهّار نیست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: جز اين نيست كه من بيم‌دهنده‌اى هستم و هيچ خدايى جز خداى يكتاى قهار نيست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: من تنها يك بيم دهنده‌ام و جز خداى يگانه قهار معبودى نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «من فقط هشداردهنده‌اى هستم، و جز خداى يگانه قهار معبودى ديگر نيست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو که من رسولی منذر (و ناصح) بیش نیستم و جز خدای فرد قهّار (که بر همه عالم غالب و قاهر است) خدایی نیست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: من تنها بیم دهنده (ی مردمان از عذاب یزدان) می‌باشم و بس. و هیچ معبودی جز خداوند یگانه‌ی غالب (بر هر چیز و هر کس) وجود ندارد. [[«مُنذِرٌ»: بیم دهنده. «الْقَهَّارُ»: غالب بر هر کس، و چیره بر هر چیز.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو من فقط هشداردهنده‌ام و خدایی جز خداوند یگانه قهار نیست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «من تنها یک بیم‌دهنده‌ام؛ و هیچ معبودی جز خداوند یگانه قهّار نیست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو جز این نیست که منم ترساننده و نیست خداوندی جز خدای یگانه خشم‌آور

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: همانا من بيم‌كننده‌اى هستم و خدايى نيست جز خداى يگانه بر همه چيره.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «من تنها هشداردهنده‌ای هستم و جز خدای یگانه‌ی قهّار معبودی دگر نیست.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "I am only a warner, and there is no other god but God, the one, the omnipotent,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Proclaim (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “I am purely a Herald of Warning – and there is no God except Allah, the One, the All Dominant.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'I am only a warner. There is not any god but God, the One, the Omnipotent,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: I am but warner, and there is no god but Allah, the One, the Subduer.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "I am only a warner and there is no Ilah (God) except Allah (none has the right to be worshipped but Allah) the One, the Irresistible,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “I am only a warner, and there is no god except God—the One, the Conqueror.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Tell them, (O Prophet): “I am nothing but a warner. There is no deity but Allah, the One, the Supreme,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "I am only a warner and there is no God (worthy of worship) except Allah the One, the Irresistible,"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): I am only a warner, and there is no Allah save Allah, the One, the Absolute,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘I am just a warner, and there is no god except Allah, the One, the All-paramount,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'I am only a warner. There is no god except Allah, the One, the Conqueror,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, [O Muhammad], "I am only a warner, and there is not any deity except Allah, the One, the Prevailing.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad) say, "I am only a warner. The only Lord is God, the Almighty.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: I am only a warner, and there is no god but Allah, the One, the Subduer (of all):

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul innama ana munthirun wama min ilahin illa Allahu alwahidu alqahharu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, [Prophet], "I am only a warner. There is no god but God, the One, the All-Powerful,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "Truly am I a Warner: no god is there but the one Allah, Supreme and Irresistible,-

verses.text: رَبُ‌ السَّمَاوَاتِ‌ وَ الْأَرْضِ‌ وَ مَا بَيْنَهُمَا الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفَّارُ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پروردگار آسمان ها و زمین و آنچه میان آنهاست، توانای شکست ناپذیر و بسیار آمرزنده است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آن پيروزمند و آمرزنده، پروردگار آسمانها و زمين و هر چه ميان آنهاست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پروردگار آسمان‌ها و زمين و آنچه ميان آنهاست كه توانا و آمرزنده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پروردگار آسمانها و زمين و آنچه ميان آن دو است، همان شكست‌ناپذير آمرزنده.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آفریننده آسمانها و زمین و هر چه بین آنهاست، همان خدای مقتدر و بسیار آمرزنده.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پروردگار آسمانها و زمین و همه‌ی چیزهائی است که در میان آن دو است و بسیار با عزّت و آمرزگار است. [[«رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَ ...»: (نگا: شعراء / 24). «الْغَفَّارُ»: (نگا: طه / 82، نوح / 10).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پروردگار آسمانها و زمین و مابین آنها که پیروزمند آمرزگار است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پروردگار آسمانها و زمین و آنچه میان آن دو است، پروردگار عزیز و غفّار!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پروردگار آسمانها و زمین و آنچه میان آنها است مهتر آمرزگار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: خداوند آسمانها و زمين و آنچه ميان آنهاست، آن تواناى بى‌همتا و آمرزگار.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پروردگار آسمان‌ها و زمین و آنچه میان آن دو است. (همان) عزیزِ بسی پوشنده‌.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, all-mighty, all-forgiving."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them – the Almighty, the Oft Forgiving.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and earth, and of what between them is, the All-mighty, the All-forgiving.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatsoever is in- between the twain, the Mighty, the Forgiver.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the All-Mighty, the Oft-Forgiving."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them; the Mighty, the Forgiver.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is in between them, the Most Mighty, the Most Forgiving.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Almighty, the Oft-Forgiving."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Mighty, the Pardoning.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the All-mighty, the All-forgiver.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them; the Almighty, the Forgiving'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He is the Lord of the heavens, the earth, and all that is between them, the Majestic and All-forgiving".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, the Mighty, the most Forgiving.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Rabbu alssamawati waalardi wama baynahuma alAAazeezu alghaffaru

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and earth and everything between them, the Almighty, the Most Forgiving."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all between,- Exalted in Might, able to enforce His Will, forgiving again and again."

verses.text: قُلْ‌ هُوَ نَبَأٌ عَظِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: این [قرآن من] خبری بزرگ است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: اين خبرى بزرگ است،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: اين خبرى بزرگ است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «اين خبرى بزرگ است،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو آن (حکایت که از قیامت و اهل بهشت و دوزخ برای شما آوردم) خبر بزرگ عالم است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: (آنچه من شما را به وسیله‌ی) آن (بیم می‌دهم که قرآن بزرگوار است) خبر سترگی است. [[«نَبَؤٌاْ»: خبر مهمّ و سرگذشت قابل توجّه (نگا: انعام / 34 و 67، اعراف / 175). در اینجا مراد قرآن است که خبر بزرگی است درباره سرنوشت مؤمنان و کافران و سعادت و شقاوت دنیوی و اخروی ایشان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو آن خبری است بس بزرگ‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «این خبری بزرگ است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو آن داستانی است بزرگ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: آن- رسالت من يا قرآن يا رستاخيز- خبرى بزرگ است،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «آن خبری مهم (و) بزرگ است.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "This is a momentous message,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Say, “That is a great tidings.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'It is a mighty tiding

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: it is a tiding mighty.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say: "That (this Quran) is a great news,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “It is a message of great importance.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say: “This is a tiding of tremendous import

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "That is a great news,"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: It is tremendous tidings

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘It is a great prophesy,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'This is a mighty message

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "It is great news

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Say, "It (facts about the supremacy of God) is the greatest message,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: It is a message of importance,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul huwa nabaon AAatheemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "This is momentous news,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "That is a Message Supreme (above all),-

verses.text: أَنْتُمْ‌ عَنْهُ‌ مُعْرِضُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که شما از آن روی می گردانید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه شما از آن اعراض مى‌كنيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [كه‌] شما از آن رويگردانيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [كه‌] شما از آن روى برمى‌تابيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (و دریغا که) شما از شنیدن آن خبر بزرگ اعراض می‌کنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: شما (بر اثر غفلت) از آن رو گردانید. [[«مُعْرِضُونَ»: (نگا: بقره / 83، آل‌عمران / 23).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که شما از آن رویگردانید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که شما از آن روی‌گردانید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که شمائید از او روی‌گردانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه شما از آن رويگردانيد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «شما از آن روی برمی‌تابید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: To which you pay no heed.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “You are neglectful of it!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: from which you are turning away.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Ye are therefrom averting.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "From which you turn away!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: From which you are turning away.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: from which you are turning away.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "From which you turn away!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Whence ye turn away!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: of which you are disregardful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: from which you turn away.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: From which you turn away.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: but you have turned away from it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: (And) you are turning aside from it:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Antum AAanhu muAAridoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: yet you ignore it.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "From which ye do turn away!

verses.text: مَا کَانَ‌ لِي‌ مِنْ‌ عِلْمٍ‌ بِالْمَلَإِ الْأَعْلَى‌ إِذْ يَخْتَصِمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: من از ملأ اعلی هنگامی که [درباره آفرینش آدم] مجادله می کردند، هیچ خبری ندارم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هنگامى كه با يكديگر جدال مى‌كردند من خبرى از ساكنان عالم بالا نداشتم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مرا از ساكنان عالم بالا به هنگامى كه [در باره‌ى خلقت آدم‌] مخاصمه مى‌كردند هيچ آگاهى نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مرا در باره ملاء اعلى هيچ دانشى نبود آنگاه كه مجادله مى‌كردند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: مرا بر فرشتگان عالم بالا که (در قضیّه خلق آدم یا غیر آن) خصومت و گفتگو داشتند علمی (پیش از وحی خدا) نبود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: من از ملأ اعلی (و فرشتگان عالم بالا) هنگامی که (درباره‌ی آفرینش آدم) گفتگو می‌کردند، خبر ندارم. (تنها چیزی که در این زمینه می‌دانم آن مقداری است که از طریق وحی به من رسیده است و بس). [[«الْمَلإِ الأَعْلی»: در اینجا مراد فرشتگان و آنانی است که بدیشان دستور داده شد که برای آدم سجده برند (نگا: بقره / 30) همان گونه که آیه 71 همین سوره بیانگر آن است. «إِذْ»: زمانی که. بدان گاه که. «یَخْتَصِمُونَ»: جدال و نزاع می‌کردند. مراد از مجادله و منازعه، بحث و گفتگو درباره آفرینش انسان است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مرا هیچ آگاهی از ملأاعلی نیست، آنگاه که [فرشتگان‌] مجادله کردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: من از ملأ اعلی (و فرشتگان عالم بالا) به هنگامی که (درباره آفرینش آدم) مخاصمه می‌کردند خبر ندارم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نیست مرا دانائی به گروه بالا گاهی که می‌ستیزند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مرا هيچ دانشى به آن گروه برين- فرشتگان- نبود آنگاه كه با يكديگر گفت‌وگو مى‌كردند- در باره آفرينش آدم-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «مرا درباره‌ی ملأ اعلی هیچ آگاهی نبوده است، چون با هم مجادله می‌کردند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: I had no knowledge of the higher Assembly when they discussed it among themselves.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “What did I know of the heavenly world, when the angels had disputed.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: I had no knowledge of the High Council when they disputed.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: I had no knowledge of the chiefs on high when they disputed;

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "I had no knowledge of the chiefs (angels) on high when they were disputing and discussing (about the creation of Adam).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: I have no knowledge of the Highest Assembly as they dispute.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (Tell them): “I had no knowledge of the High Council when they were disputing.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "I had no knowledge of the chiefs (angels) on high when they were disputing and discussing."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: I had no knowledge of the Highest Chiefs when they disputed;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: I have no knowledge of the Supernal Elite when they contend.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: I had no knowledge of the High Assembly's dispute.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [the creation of Adam].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: I have no knowledge of the dispute among the angels (concerning their attitude towards Adam).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: I had no knowledge of the exalted chiefs when they contended:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ma kana liya min AAilmin bialmalai alaAAla ith yakhtasimoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: I had no knowledge of the Exalted Assembly when they argued [against the creation of man]:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "No knowledge have I of the Chiefs on high, when they discuss (matters) among themselves.

verses.text: إِنْ‌ يُوحَى‌ إِلَيَ‌ إِلاَّ أَنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به من وحی نمی شود جز برای اینکه بیم دهنده ای آشکارم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تنها از آن روى به من وحى مى‌شود كه بيم‌دهنده‌اى روشنگر هستم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: تنها از آن جهت به من وحى مى‌شود كه من فقط بيم دهنده‌اى آشكارم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: به من هيچ [چيز] وحى نمى‌شود، جز اينكه من هشداردهنده‌اى آشكارم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و به من وحی نمی‌رسد جز اینکه من با بیان روشن و آشکار (خلق را از عذاب خدا) بترسانم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به من هم وحی نمی‌شود مگر بدان خاطر که (پیغمبر خدایم و) بیم دهنده‌ی (مردمان از عذاب یزدان و) بیانگر (اوامر و نواهی الهی) می‌باشم. [[«إِن یُوحی»: وحی نمی‌شود. حرف (إِنْ) نافیه است. نائب فاعل (یُوحی) ضمیر مستتر است. یعنی: مَا یُوحی إِلَیَّ حالُ الْمَلإِ الأعْلی. یا این که: مَا یُوحی إِلَیَّ الَّذِی یُوحی مِنَ الأمُورِ الْغَیْبِیَّةِ ... إِلاّ لأنِّی نَذِیرٌ مُبِینٌ مِنْ جِهَتِهِ تَعَالی. «إِلاّ أَنَّمَا أَنَا ...»: مگر بدان خاطر که من. معنی حصر بدان می‌ماند که به کسی گفته شود: لَمْ تُسْتَقْضَ یَا فُلانُ إِلاّ لِأَنَّکَ عالِمٌ عامِلٌ مُرْشِدٌ. ای فلانی! از تو داوری خواسته نمی‌شود مگر بدان خاطر که تو دانا هستی و به دانش خود عمل می‌کنی و راهنمای دیگرانی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: به من وحی نمی‌شود جز در این باب که من هشداردهنده‌ای آشکارم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تنها چیزی که به من وحی می‌شود این است که من انذارکننده آشکاری هستم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: وحی نمی‌شود به من جز آنکه منم ترساننده آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: به من وحى نمى‌شود مگر از آن رو كه من آشكارا بيم‌كننده‌ام.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «به من هیچ (چیز) وحی نمی‌شود، جز اینکه تنها من به‌راستی هشداردهنده‌ای روشنگرم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Only this has been revealed to me that I am a distinct warner.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “I receive only the divine revelations, that I am purely a clear Herald of Warning.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: This alone is revealed to me, that I am only a clear warner.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Naught is revealed Unto me except that I am a warner manifest.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Only this has been inspired to me, that I am a plain warner."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is only revealed to me that I am a clear warner.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: I am told (about matters) by means of revelation only because I am a clear warner.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Only this has been revealed to me, that I am a plain warner."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It is revealed unto me only that I may be a plain warner.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: All that is revealed to me is that I am just a manifest warner.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: This alone is revealed to me, I am only a clear warner'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: It has not been revealed to me except that I am a clear warner."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: I have only received revelation to give you plain warning.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Naught is revealed to me save that I am a plain warner.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: In yooha ilayya illa annama ana natheerun mubeenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: it has only been revealed to me that I am a plain warner."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: 'Only this has been revealed to me: that I am to give warning plainly and publicly."

verses.text: إِذْ قَالَ‌ رَبُّکَ‌ لِلْمَلاَئِکَةِ إِنِّي‌ خَالِقٌ‌ بَشَراً مِنْ‌ طِينٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [یاد کن] هنگامی را که پروردگارت به فرشتگان گفت: همانا من بشری از گل خواهم آفرید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پروردگارت به فرشتگان گفت: من بشرى را از گل مى‌آفرينم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آن‌گاه كه پروردگارت به فرشتگان گفت: من آفريننده‌ى بشرى از گل خواهم بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه كه پروردگارت به فرشتگان گفت: «من بشرى را از گِل خواهم آفريد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (یاد کن) هنگامی که خدایت به فرشتگان گفت که من بشری از گل خواهم آفرید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: وقتی (این گفتگو در ملأ اَعلی و عالَم بالا درگرفت) که پروردگارت به فرشتگان گفت: من انسانی را از گِل می‌آفرینم. [[«إِذْ قَالَ رَبُّکَ ...»: بیان گفتگوئی است که در ملأ اعلی و عالم بالا در گرفته است. «بَشَراً»: مراد آدم است. «طِینٍ»: گِل.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چنین بود که پروردگارت به فرشتگان فرمود همانا من آفریننده انسانی از گل هستم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و به خاطر بیاور هنگامی را که پروردگارت به فرشتگان گفت: «من بشری را از گل می‌آفرینم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هنگامی که گفت پروردگارت به فرشتگان من آفریننده بشری از گِل‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [ياد كن‌] آنگاه كه پروردگار تو به فرشتگان گفت: من آدميى از گِل مى‌آفرينم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: چون پروردگارت به فرشتگان گفت: «من بی‌گمان آفریننده‌ی بشری از گل هستم‌.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When your Lord said to the angels: "I am going to create a man from clay;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: (Remember) When your Lord said to the angels, “I will create a human from clay.” –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: When thy Lord said to the angels, 'See, I am creating a mortal of a clay.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Recall what time thy Lord said Unto the angels: verily I am about to create a human being from clay;

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Remember) when your Lord said to the angels: "Truly, I am going to create man from clay".

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Your Lord said to the angels, “I am creating a human being from clay.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: When your Lord said to the angels: “Verily I am creating a human being from clay.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (Remember) when your Lord said to the angels: "Truly, I am going to create man from clay."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: When thy Lord said unto the angels: Lo! I am about to create a mortal out of mire,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When your Lord said to the angels, ‘Indeed I am about to create a human being out of clay.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When your Lord said to the angels: 'I am creating a human from clay,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [So mention] when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When your Lord told the angels, "I will create a mortal out of clay,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: When your Lord said to the angels; Surely I am going to create a mortal from dust:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ith qala rabbuka lilmalaikati innee khaliqun basharan min teenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Your Lord said to the angels, "I am about to create a human being out of clay;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Behold, thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man from clay:

verses.text: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُ‌ وَ نَفَخْتُ‌ فِيهِ‌ مِنْ‌ رُوحِي‌ فَقَعُوا لَهُ‌ سَاجِدِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس زمانی که اندامش را درست و نیکو نمودم و از روح خود در او دمیدم، برای او سجده کنید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون تمامش كردم و در آن از روح خود دميدم، همه سجده‌اش كنيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس چون او را [كاملا] نظام بخشيدم و از روح خويش در وى دميدم براى او به سجده افتيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس چون او را [كاملاً] درست كردم و از روح خويش در آن دميدم، سجده‌كنان براى او [به خاك‌] بيفتيد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس آن گاه که او را به خلقت کامل بیاراستم و از روح خود در او بدمیدم بر او به سجده در افتید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که آن را سر و سامان دادم و آراسته و پیراسته کردم، و از جان متعلّق به خود در او دمیدم، در برابرش سجده (ی بزرگداشت و درود) ببرید. [[«فَإِذَا سَوَّیْتُهُ ...»: (نگا: حجر / 29).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس چون او را استوار بپرداختم، و در آن از روح خود دمیدم برای او به سجده در افتید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که آن را نظام بخشیدم و از روح خود در آن دمیدم، برای او به سجده افتید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا گاهی که درستش کردم و دمیدم در او از روح خویش پس بیفتید برایش سجده‌کنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس چون او را راست و تمام گردانيدم و در وى از روح خود دميدم، او را سجده‌كنان درافتيد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پس هنگامی‌که درستش کردم و از روح برگزیده‌(ی آفرینش)ام در او دمیدم، سجده‌کنان برای او (در برابر من) فرو اُفتید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And when I have made him and have breathed into him of My spirit. Fall down in homage before him."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “So when I have perfected him and breathed into him a spirit from Myself, (you all) fall down before him in prostration.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: When I have shaped him, and breathed My spirit in him, fall you down, bowing before him!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then when I have formed him and breathed into him of My spirit, fall down before him prostrate.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So when I have fashioned him and breathed into him (his) soul created by Me, then you fall down prostrate to him."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When I have formed him, and breathed into him of My spirit, fall prostrate before him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: After I have created him and breathed into him of My spirit, fall you down, prostrating yourselves to him.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "So, when I have fashioned him and breathed into him (his) soul created by Me, then you fall down prostrate to him."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My Spirit, then fall down before him prostrate,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My spirit, then fall down in prostration before him.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: after I have shaped him and breathed of My spirit (I created) into him, fall down prostrate before him'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and when I give it proper shape and blow My spirit into it, bow down in prostration to him,"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So when I have made him complete and breathed into him of My spirit, then fall down making obeisance to him.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faitha sawwaytuhu wanafakhtu feehi min roohee faqaAAoo lahu sajideena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and when I have formed him fully and breathed My spirit into him, prostrate yourselves before him."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "When I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into him of My spirit, fall ye down in obeisance unto him."

verses.text: فَسَجَدَ الْمَلاَئِکَةُ کُلُّهُمْ‌ أَجْمَعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس فرشتگان همه با هم سجده کردند؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: همه فرشتگان سجده كردند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس همه فرشتگان يكسره سجده كردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس همه فرشتگان يكسره سجده كردند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس تمام فرشتگان بدون استثنا سجده کردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس همه‌ی فرشتگان جملگی سجده بردند. [[«فَسَجَدَ الْمَلآئِکَةُ ...»: (نگا: حجر / 30).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه فرشتگان همگی سجده کردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در آن هنگام همه فرشتگان سجده کردند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس سجده کردند فرشتگان همگی با هم‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس فرشتگان همه با هم سجده كردند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس فرشتگان همگان با هم سجده کردند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then the angels bowed before him in a body,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So all the angels prostrated, every one, without exception.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then the angels bowed themselves all together,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: The angels prostrated themselves, all of them.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them:

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So the angels fell prostrate, all of them.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then the angels, all of them, prostrated themselves before Adam

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, the angels prostrated themselves, all of them,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: The angels fell down prostrate, every one,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Thereat the angels prostrated, all of them together,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So all the angels prostrated themselves

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: all the angel then prostrated themselves

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the angels did obeisance, all of them,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fasajada almalaikatu kulluhum ajmaAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Thereupon the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:

verses.text: إِلاَّ إِبْلِيسَ‌ اسْتَکْبَرَ وَ کَانَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْکَافِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مگر ابلیس که تکبّر ورزید و از کافران شد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر ابليس كه بزرگى فروخت و از كافران شد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر ابليس كه بزرگى فروخت و از كافران شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر ابليس [كه‌] تكبر نمود و از كافران شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: مگر شیطان که غرور و تکبر ورزید و از زمره کافران گردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: جز ابلیس که تکبّر ورزید، و از کافران گردید. [[«إِلاّ إِبْلِیسَ ...»: (نگا: بقره / 34).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر ابلیس که استکبار ورزید و از کافران شد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: جز ابلیس که تکبّر ورزید و از کافران بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: مگر ابلیس که برتری جست و شد از کافران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر ابليس كه گردنكشى و بزرگ‌منشى نمود و از كافران شد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: مگر ابلیس (که) تکبّر جُست و از کافران بود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Except Iblis. He was filled with pride and turned an unbeliever.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Except Iblis; he was proud and was, from the beginning, a disbeliever.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: save Iblis; he waxed proud, and was one of the unbelievers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Not so lblis. He grew stiffnecked and became of the infidels.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Except Iblis (Satan) he was proud and was one of the disbelievers.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Except for Satan. He was too proud, and one of the faithless.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: except Iblis. He waxed proud and became one of the unbelievers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Except Iblis, he was proud and was one of the disbelievers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Saving Iblis; he was scornful and became one of the disbelievers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: but not Iblis; he acted arrogantly and he was one of the faithless.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: except iblis (satan, the father of the jinn), he became too proud, for he was one of the unbelievers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Except Iblees; he was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: except Iblis who puffed himself up with pride and became a disbeliever.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But not Iblis: he was proud and he was one of the unbelievers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa ibleesa istakbara wakana mina alkafireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but not Satan, who was too proud. He became one of those who deny the truth.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Not so Iblis: he was haughty, and became one of those who reject Faith.

verses.text: قَالَ‌ يَا إِبْلِيسُ‌ مَا مَنَعَکَ‌ أَنْ‌ تَسْجُدَ لِمَا خَلَقْتُ‌ بِيَدَيَ‌ أَسْتَکْبَرْتَ‌ أَمْ‌ کُنْتَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْعَالِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [خدا] فرمود: ای ابلیس! تو را چه چیزی از سجده کردن بر آنچه که با دستان قدرت خود آفریدم، بازداشت؟ آیا تکبّر کردی یا از بلند مرتبه گانی؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: اى ابليس، چه چيز تو را از سجده كردن در برابر آنچه من با دو دست خود آفريده‌ام منع كرد؟ آيا بزرگى فروختى يا مقامى ارجمند داشتى؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: اى ابليس! چه چيز تو را بازداشت از اين كه براى چيزى كه به دستان قدرت خود آفريدم سجده كنى؟ آيا خود را بزرگ پنداشتى يا [واقعا] از بلند پايگان بودى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: فرمود: «اى ابليس، چه چيز تو را مانع شد كه براى چيزى كه به دستان قدرت خويش خلق كردم سجده آورى؟ آيا تكبر نمودى يا از [جمله‌] برترى‌جويانى؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: خدا به شیطان فرمود: ای ابلیس، تو را چه مانع شد که به موجودی (با قدر و شرافت) که من به دو دست (علم و قدرت) خود آفریدم سجده کنی؟ آیا تکبر و نخوت کردی یا از فرشتگان بلند رتبه عالم قدس اعلا بودی (که نمی‌بایست سجده کنند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: فرمود: ای ابلیس! چه چیز تو را بازداشت از این که سجده ببری برای چیزی که من آن را مستقیماً با قدرت خود آفریده‌ام؟ آیا تکبّر ورزیده‌ای یا اصلاً از متکبّران بوده‌ای؟ [[«خَلَقْتُ بِیَدَیَّ»: مستقیماً و بدون واسطه چیز دیگری، از قبیل پدر و مادر، آن را با قدرت خود آفریده‌ام. (یَد) کنایه از قدرت است. «أَسْتَکْبَرْتَ»: مراد این است که هم اینک خود را به بزرگی می‌زنی و تکبّر می‌ورزی. «أَمْ کُنتَ مِنَ الْعَالِینَ»: یا این که همواره از متکبّران و خود بزرگ بینان بوده‌ای. «الْعَالِینَ»: (نگا: یونس / 83، دخان / 31، مؤمنون / 46).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: فرمود ای ابلیس چه چیزی تو را از سجده به آنچه با دستان خویش آفریده‌ام، بازداشت؟ آیا استکبار ورزیدی یا از بلندمرتبگان بودی؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «ای ابلیس! چه چیز مانع تو شد که بر مخلوقی که با قدرت خود او را آفریدم سجده کنی؟! آیا تکبّر کردی یا از برترینها بودی؟! (برتر از اینکه فرمان سجود به تو داده شود!)»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت ای ابلیس چه بازداشت تو را از آنچه سجده کنی برای آنچه آفریدم با دستهایم آیا کبر ورزیدی یا شدی از برتری‌جویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [خداى‌] گفت: اى ابليس، تو را چه باز داشت از آنكه سجده كنى آن را كه با دو دست [قدرت‌] خويش آفريدم؟ آيا خود را بزرگ ديدى يا از برترى‌جويان بودى؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: فرمود: «ای ابلیس! چه چیز تو را مانع شد برای چیزی که به دو دست (قدرت) خویش آفریدم سجده آوری‌؟ آیا تکبّر نمودی یا از مهتران و برجستگان بوده‌ای‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Said (God): "O Iblis, what hindered you from adoring what I created by My own authority? Are you too proud, or too high and mighty?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said Allah, “O Iblis! What prevented you from prostrating before one whom I have created with My hands*? Have you become proud or were you haughty from the beginning?” (Used as a metaphor).

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said He, 'Iblis, what prevented thee to bow thyself before that I created with My own hands? Hast thou waxed proud, or art thou of the lofty ones?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Allah said: O Iblis! what preventeth thee from prostrating thyself before that which have created with both my hands? Becomest thou stiff-necked, or art thou of the exalted ones?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Allah) said: "O Iblis (Satan)! What prevents you from prostrating yourself to one whom I have created with Both My Hands. Are you too proud (to fall prostrate to Adam) or are you one of the high exalted?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “O Satan, what prevented you from prostrating before what I created with My Own hands? Are you too proud, or were you one of the exalted?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: The Lord said: “O Iblis, what prevented you from prostrating yourself before him whom I created of My Two Hands. Are you waxing proud, or fancy yourself to be too exalted?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (Allah) said: "O Iblis! What prevents you from prostrating yourself to one whom I have created with Both My Hands. Are you too proud or are you one of the high exalted"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: O Iblis! What hindereth thee from falling prostrate before that which I have created with both My hands? Art thou too proud or art thou of the high exalted?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘O Iblis! What keeps you from prostrating before that which I have created with My [own] two hands? Are you arrogant, or are you one of the exalted ones?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He (Allah) said: 'iblis, what prevented you from prostrating yourself towards that which I have created with My Hands? Have you become too proud, or areyou among the grand'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Allah] said, "O Iblees, what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands? Were you arrogant [then], or were you [already] among the haughty?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Lord said, "Iblis, what prevented you from prostrating before what I have created with My own hands? Was it because of your pride or are you truly exalted?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: O Iblis! what prevented you that you should do obeisance to him whom I created with My two hands? Are you proud or are you of the exalted ones?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala ya ibleesu ma manaAAaka an tasjuda lima khalaqtu biyadayya astakbarta am kunta mina alAAaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: God said, "Satan, what prevented you from prostrating yourself to what I created with My own Hands? Were you overcome by arrogance, or are you of those who think [only] of themselves as exalted?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Allah) said: "O Iblis! What prevents thee from prostrating thyself to one whom I have created with my hands? Art thou haughty? Or art thou one of the high (and mighty) ones?"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ أَنَا خَيْرٌ مِنْهُ‌ خَلَقْتَنِي‌ مِنْ‌ نَارٍ وَ خَلَقْتَهُ‌ مِنْ‌ طِينٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: من از او بهترم، مرا از آتش آفریدی و او را از گل ساختی.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: من از او بهترم. مرا از آتش آفريده‌اى و او را از گل.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: من از او بهترم، مرا از آتش و او را از گل آفريدى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «من از او بهترم؛ مرا از آتش آفريده‌اى و او را از گِل آفريده‌اى.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: شیطان گفت: من از او بهترم، که مرا از آتش (نورانی سرکش) و او را از گل (تیره پست) خلقت کرده‌ای.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفت: من بهتر از او هستم. تو مرا از آتش آفریده‌ای و وی را از گِل. [[«قَالَ أَنَا خَیْرٌ ...»: (نگا: اعراف / 12).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت من بهتر از او هستم، [چرا] که مرا از آتش آفریده‌ای و او را از گل آفریده‌ای‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «من از او بهترم؛ مرا از آتش آفریده‌ای و او را از گل!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت من بهترم از او مرا آفریدی از آتش و آفریدی او را از گِل‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: من از وى بهترم، مرا از آتش آفريدى و او را از گِل.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «من از او بهترم‌؛ مرا از آتش آفریدی و او را از گل آفریدی.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He said: "I am better than he. You created me from fire, and him from clay."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said Iblis, “I am better than him; You made me from fire, and You have created him from clay!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said he, 'I am better than he; Thou createdst me of fire, and him Thou createdst of clay.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: I am better than he: me Thou hast created of fire, and him Thou hast created of clay.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Iblis (Satan)] said: "I am better than he, You created me from fire, and You created him from clay."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “I am better than he; You created me from fire, and You created him from clay.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He replied: “I am nobler than he. You created me from fire and created him from clay.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: [Iblis] said: "I am better than he. You created me from fire, and You created him from clay."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: I am better than him. Thou createdst me of fire, whilst him Thou didst create of clay.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘I am better than him,’ he said. ‘You created me from fire and You created him from clay.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He (satan) replied: 'I am better than he. You created me from fire, and You created him from clay'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He said, "I am better than him. You have created me from fire and him out of clay".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: I am better than he; Thou hast created me of fire, and him Thou didst create of dust.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala ana khayrun minhu khalaqtanee min narin wakhalaqtahu min teenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Satan replied, "I am better than him. You created me from fire, but You created him from clay."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Iblis) said: "I am better than he: thou createdst me from fire, and him thou createdst from clay."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ فَاخْرُجْ‌ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّکَ‌ رَجِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [خدا] گفت: از آن [جایگاه] بیرون رو که بی تردید تو رانده شده ای؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: از اينجا بيرون شو كه تو مطرودى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: پس، از آن بيرون شو، كه تو مطرودى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: فرمود: «پس، از آن [مقام‌] بيرون شو، كه تو رانده‌اى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: خدا فرمود (ای شیطان جاهل خودبین) اینک از این جایگاه بیرون رو که تو (غرور و تکبر کردی و) سخت رانده درگاه ما شدی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفت: از میان آن (جماعتِ ملأ اعلی و فرشتگان عالَم بالا) بیرون شو، چرا که تو مطرود (از رحمت ما) و رانده شده (از میان فرشتگان) هستی. [[«مِنْهَا»: از جنت. از آسمان. از جماعت فرشتگان. «رَجِیمٌ»: مطرود از درگاه رحمت و کرامت خدا. رانده شده از میان صفوف فرشتگان (نگا: آل‌عمران / 36، حجر / 17 و 34، نحل / 98).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: فرمود از آنجا بیرون شو که تو مطرودی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: فرمود: «از آسمانها (و صفوف ملائکه) خارج شو، که تو رانده درگاه منی!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت پس برون شو از آن که توئی رانده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: پس، از آنجا بيرون شو، كه همانا تو رانده‌شده‌اى

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: فرمود: «پس، از آن (باغ) برون شو، پس تو بی‌گمان رانده شده‌ای.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (God) said: "Then go hence, ostracised.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “Therefore exit from heaven, for you have been outcast.” (To disrespect the Prophets – peace and blessings be upon them – is blasphemy.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said He, 'Then go thou forth hence; thou art accursed.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Allah said: get thee forth therefrom verify thou art driven away.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Allah) said: "Then get out from here, for verily, you are outcast.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “Then get out of here! You are an outcast!

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He said: “Get out of here; surely you are accursed,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (Allah) said: "Then get out from here; for verily, you are outcast."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Go forth from hence, for lo! thou art outcast,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Begone hence, for you are indeed an outcast,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Begone' said He, 'you are stoned'.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Allah] said, "Then get out of Paradise, for indeed, you are expelled.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Lord said, "Get out of here. You deserve to be stoned!

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Then get out of it, for surely you are driven away:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala faokhruj minha fainnaka rajeemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "Begone! You are accursed:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Allah) said: "Then get thee out from here: for thou art rejected, accursed.

verses.text: وَ إِنَ‌ عَلَيْکَ‌ لَعْنَتِي‌ إِلَى‌ يَوْمِ‌ الدِّينِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و حتماً لعنت من تا روز قیامت بر تو باد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و تا روز قيامت لعنت من بر توست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و تا روز جزا لعنت من بر توست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و تا روز جزا لعنت من بر تو باد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و بر تو لعنت (و غضب) من تا روز جزا حتمی و محقّق است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: قطعاً نفرین من تا روز جزا بر تو خواهد بود. [[«یَوْمِ الدِِّینِ»: (نگا: فاتحه / 4، حجر / 35، شعراء / 82، صافّات / 20). «إِلی یَوْمِ الدِّینِ»: همیشه تا روز قیامت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و لعنت من تا روز جزا بر تو خواهد بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و مسلّماً لعنت من بر تو تا روز قیامت خواهد بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا بر تو است لعن من تا روز دین‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همانا لعنت من تا روز رستاخيز و پاداش بر توست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و تا روز بُروز طاعت [:قیامت] همواره بر تو لعنت و دورباش من است.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Upon you will be My damnation till the Day of Doom."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And indeed My curse is upon you till the Day of Judgement.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Upon thee shall rest My curse, till the Day of Doom.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily My curse shall be on thee till the Day of Requital,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And verily!, My Curse is on you till the Day of Recompense."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And My curse will be upon you until the Day of Judgment.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and My curse shall remain upon you till the Day of Resurrection.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And verily, My curse is on you till the Day of Recompense."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! My curse is on thee till the Day of Judgment.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and indeed My curse will be on you till the Day of Retribution.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'My curse shall rest on you until the Day of Recompense'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, upon you is My curse until the Day of Recompense."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: My condemnation will be with you until the Day of Judgment!"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And surely My curse is on you to the day of judgment.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna AAalayka laAAnatee ila yawmi alddeeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: My curse will remain upon you till the Day of Judgement!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And My curse shall be on thee till the Day of Judgment."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ رَبِ‌ فَأَنْظِرْنِي‌ إِلَى‌ يَوْمِ‌ يُبْعَثُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: پروردگارا! مرا تا روزی که مردم برانگیخته می شوند، مهلت ده.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: اى پروردگار من، مرا تا روزى كه از نو زنده شوند مهلت ده.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: پروردگارا! پس مرا تا روزى كه برانگيخته مى‌شوند مهلت ده

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «پروردگارا، پس مرا تا روزى كه برانگيخته مى‌شوند مهلت ده.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: شیطان عرض کرد: پروردگارا، پس مهلتم ده که تا روز قیامت زنده مانم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفت: پروردگارا! (حال که چنین است) پس تا روزی مرا مهلت بده و ممیران که مردمان دوباره زنده می‌گردند (و رستاخیز شروع می‌شود). [[«فَأَنظِرْنِی ...»: (نگا: اعراف / 14، حجر / 36).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت پروردگارا پس مرا تا روزی که [مردمان‌] برانگیخته شوند مهلت ده‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «پروردگارا! مرا تا روزی که انسانها برانگیخته می‌شوند مهلت ده!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت پروردگارا پس مهلتم ده تا روزی که برانگیخته شوند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: خداوندا، پس مرا تا روزى كه [از نو زنده و] برانگيخته شوند مهلت ده.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «پروردگارم! پس مرا تا روزی که برانگیخته می‌شوند مهلت ده.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He said: "O Lord, give me respite till the day the dead rise from their graves."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “My Lord! Therefore give me respite till the day when all will be raised.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said he, 'My Lord, respite me till the day they shall be raised.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: my Lord! respite me till the Day whereon they are raised up.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Iblis (Satan)] said: "My Lord! Give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are resurrected."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “Lord, defer me until the Day they are resurrected.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Satan said: “My Lord, then grant me respite till the Day that they are raised up.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: [Iblis] said: "My Lord! Give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are resurrected."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: My Lord! Reprieve me till the day when they are raised.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘My Lord! Respite me till the day they will be resurrected.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He (satan) replied: 'Respite me my Lord till the Day of Resurrection'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He said, "Lord, grant me respite until the Day of Resurrection".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: My Lord! then respite me to the day that they are raised.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala rabbi faanthirnee ila yawmi yubAAathoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But Satan said, "My Lord, grant me respite until the Day of Resurrection,"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! Give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are raised."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ فَإِنَّکَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُنْظَرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [خدا] گفت: تو از مهلت یافتگانی،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: تو از مهلت يافتگانى،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: حتما تو از مهلت يافتگانى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: فرمود: «در حقيقت، تو از مهلت‌يافتگانى،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: خدا فرمود: از مهلت یافتگانت قرار دادیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: فرمود: تو از مهلت داده‌شدگانی (و تا پایان جهان زنده می‌مانی). [[«الْمُنظَرِینَ»: (نگا: اعراف / 15، حجر / 8 و 37).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: فرمود [پذیرفتم‌] تو از مهلت یافتگانی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: فرمود: «تو از مهلت داده‌شدگانی،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت همانا توئی از مهلت‌دادگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: همانا تو از مهلت‌يافتگانى،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: فرمود: «پس بی‌گمان، تو از مهلت‌یافتگانی»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (God) said: "You have the respite

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said Allah, “You are therefore among those given respite.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said He, 'Thou art among the ones that are respited

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Allah said: verily, thou art of those respited.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Allah) said: "Verily! You are of those allowed respite

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “You are one of those deferred.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He said: “You are of those who have been granted respite

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (Allah) said: "Verily, you are of those allowed respite,"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Lo! thou art of those reprieved

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Said He, ‘You are indeed among the reprieved

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He (Allah) said: 'You are among those that are respited

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Allah] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Lord said, "You will only be given a respite

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Surely you are of the respited ones,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala fainnaka mina almunthareena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: so He said, "You are granted respite

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Allah) said: "Respite then is granted thee-

verses.text: إِلَى‌ يَوْمِ‌ الْوَقْتِ‌ الْمَعْلُومِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: تا زمانی معین و معلوم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تا آن روز معين معلوم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: تا روز وقت معلوم شده

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تا روز معين معلوم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تا روز معیّن و وقت معلوم (که صلاح نظام عالم می‌دانیم).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تا روز زمان معیّن (که پایان عمر جهان و سرآغاز قیامت است). [[«الْوَقْتِ الْمَعْلُومِ»: (نگا: حجر / 38). یَوْمِ الدِّینِ، یَوْمِ یُبْعَثُونَ، و یَوْمِ الْوَقْتِ الْمَعْلُومِ، همه به یک معنی است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تا روز آن هنگام معین‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ولی تا روز و زمان معیّن!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا روز هنگام دانسته‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: تا روز هنگامى معلوم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «تا روز وقت معلوم» [:قیامت مرگ].

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Till the appointed day."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Until the time of the known day.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: until the day of the known time.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Until the Day of the time appointed.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Till the Day of the time appointed."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Until the Day of the Time Appointed.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: till the Day whose Hour I know.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Till the Day of the time appointed."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Until the day of the time appointed.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: until the day of the known time.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: till the Day of the known time'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Until the Day of the time well-known."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: for an appointed time".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Till the period of the time made known.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ila yawmi alwaqti almaAAloomi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: till the Appointed Day."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Till the Day of the Time Appointed."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ فَبِعِزَّتِکَ‌ لَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ‌ أَجْمَعِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: به عزتت سوگند همه آنان را گمراه می کنم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: به عزت تو سوگند كه همگان را گمراه كنم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [ابليس‌] گفت: پس به عزت تو سوگند كه بى‌ترديد همه‌شان را گمراه خواهم كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [شيطان‌] گفت: «پس به عزّت تو سوگند كه همگى را جداً از راه به در مى‌برم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: شیطان گفت: به عزّت و جلال تو قسم که خلق را تمام گمراه خواهم کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفت: به عزّت و عظمتت سوگند که (در پرتو عمر جاویدان و تلاش بی‌امان) همه‌ی آنان را گمراه خواهم کرد. [[«لأُغْوِیَنَّهُمْ ...»: (نگا: حجر / 39).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت [سوگند] به عزت تو که همگی آنان را گمراه خواهم ساخت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «به عزّتت سوگند، همه آنان را گمراه خواهم کرد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت پس به عزّتت سوگند هر آینه گمراهشان سازم همگی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: پس به عزت تو سوگند كه البته همه آنان را گمراه كنم،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «پس به عزّتت سوگند (که) همگان را بی‌گمان بس گمراه می‌کنم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He said: "By Your authority, I will lead them astray,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “Therefore, by oath of Your honour, I will surely mislead all of them.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said he, 'Now, by Thy glory, I shall pervert them all together,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: by Thy majesty, then, I shall surely seduce them, all.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Iblis (Satan)] said: "By Your Might, then I will surely mislead them all,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “By Your majesty, I will seduce them all.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (Iblis) said: “By Your glory, I shall mislead them all

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: [Iblis] said: "By Your might, then I will surely mislead them all,"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Then, by Thy might, I surely will beguile them every one,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘By Your might, I will surely pervert them,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He (satan) said: 'I swear by Your Might, that I will seduce all of them

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Iblees] said, "By your might, I will surely mislead them all

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He said, "By Your Glory, I shall seduce all of them (children of Adam).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Then by Thy Might I will surely make them live an evil life, all,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala fabiAAizzatika laoghwiyannahum ajmaAAeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He said, "By Your Honour, I will lead all of them astray,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Iblis) said: "Then, by Thy power, I will put them all in the wrong,-

verses.text: إِلاَّ عِبَادَکَ‌ مِنْهُمُ‌ الْمُخْلَصِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مگر بندگان خالص شده ات را.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر آنها كه از بندگان مخلص تو باشند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر آن بندگان خالص تو از ميان آنها

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر آن بندگان پاكدل تو را.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: مگر خاصان از بندگانت را که دل از غیر بریدند و برای تو خالص شدند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر بندگان مخلص تو از ایشان را (که بر آنان سلطه و قدرتی نداشته و وسوسه‌ام در ایشان نمی‌گیرد). [[«الْمُخْلَصِینَ»: (نگا: یوسف / 24، حجر / 40، صافّات / 74).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر از میان آنان، آن بندگانت را که اخلاص یافته‌اند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مگر بندگان خالص تو، از میان آنها!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جز بندگان تو از ایشان آن ناآلودگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر بندگان ويژه و برگزيده‌ات از آنان- كه مرا بر ايشان راهى نيست-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «مگر بندگان اخلاص‌یافته‌ات را.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Other than the chosen ones among Your creatures."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Except Your chosen bondmen among them.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: excepting those Thy servants among them that are sincere.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Save Thy bondmen among them Sincere.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Except Your chosen slaves amongst them (faithful, obedient, true believers of Islamic Monotheism)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Except for your loyal servants among them.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: except those of Your servants, the chosen ones from amongst them.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Except Your true servants amongst them."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Save Thy single-minded slaves among them.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: except Your exclusive servants among them.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: except those among them who are Your sincere worshipers'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: except Your sincere servants among them".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Except Thy servants from among them, the purified ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa AAibadaka minhumu almukhlaseena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: except for those among them who are Your chosen servants."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Except Thy Servants amongst them, sincere and purified (by Thy Grace)."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ فَالْحَقُ‌ وَ الْحَقَ‌ أَقُولُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [خدا] گفت: سوگند به حق و فقط حق را می گویم

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: حق است و آنچه مى‌گويم راست است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: حق است و حق را مى‌گويم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: فرمود: «حق [از من‌] است و حق را مى‌گويم:

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: خدا فرمود: به حق سوگند و کلام من حق و حقیقت است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: فرمود: به حق سوگند، و حق می‌گویم (و جز حق نمی‌گویم). [[«الْحَقُّ»: مبتدا و خبر آن محذوف است، یعنی أَلْحَقُّ قَسَمی. «الْحَقَّ»: مفعول به مقدّم (أَقُولُ) است. جمله (الْحَقَّ أَقُولُ) معترضه است میان ماقبل و مابعد خود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: فرمود حق است و حق را می‌گویم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: فرمود: «به حق سوگند، و حق می‌گویم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت پس حقّ است و حقّ را گویم‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: راست است- و راست همى‌گويم-،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: فرمود: «پس (من تمامی) حق (هستم) و (همه‌ی) حقّ را می‌گویم (که)،»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (God) said: "This is right by Me, and what I say is right.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said Allah, “So this is the truth; and I speak only the truth.” –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said He, 'This is the truth, and the truth I say;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Allah said: the truth is, and it is the truth that I speak, -

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Allah) said: "The Truth is, and the Truth I say,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “The truth is, and I say the truth.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He (i.e. Allah) said: “This is the Truth -- and I only speak the Truth --

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (Allah) said: "The truth is -- the truth I say - "

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: The Truth is, and the Truth I speak,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Said He, ‘The truth is that—and I speak the truth—

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He (Allah) said: 'This is the truth, and I speak the truth:

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Allah] said, "The truth [is My oath], and the truth I say -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Lord said, "I swear by the Truth - and I speak the Truth -

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: The truth then is and the truth do I speak:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala faalhaqqu waalhaqqa aqoolu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: God said, "This is the truth, I speak only the truth,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Allah) said: "Then it is just and fitting- and I say what is just and fitting-

verses.text: لَأَمْلَأَنَ‌ جَهَنَّمَ‌ مِنْکَ‌ وَ مِمَّنْ‌ تَبِعَکَ‌ مِنْهُمْ‌ أَجْمَعِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که بی تردید دوزخ را از تو و آنان که از تو پیروی کنند، از همگی پر خواهم کرد

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه جهنم را از تو و از همه پيروانت پر كنم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به طور حتم و يقين جهنم را از تو و پيروانت يكسره پر خواهم كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
